content.raw:
@thomasko, you're right, per [spec on the MultiSense SL](http://www.theroboticschallenge.org/local/documents/MultiSense_SL.pdf), the available stereo camera modes in terms of resolution and frame rates are:

    *  mode 0 - 2MP (2048*1088) @ 1 to 15 fps
    *  mode 1 - 1MP (2048*544?) @ 1 to 30 fps
    *  mode 2 - 0.5MP (1024*544) @ 1 to 60 fps (currently supported mode @ 30fps)
    *  mode 3 - VGA (640*480) @ 1 to 70 fps

I'm modifying this pull request to set default camera raw image to mode 2 @ 30Hz, and frame rate will be adjustable by users within specified bounds.

Note that the default shipped [stereo_image_proc](ros.org/wiki/stereo_image_proc) generated point cloud output will be slow (~10Hz), but we'll try to get the raw images out at the rates described. 

**IMPORTANT:  Please read**

 * More extensive cloud testing is needed to see if the GPU in the cloud can support the  rates stated.  There is a distinct possibility that the upper bound of each resolution's frame rate will be reduced pending cloud machine status and testing.

@thomasko, you're right, per spec on the MultiSense SL, the available stereo camera modes in terms of resolution and frame rates are:

*  mode 0 - 2MP (2048*1088) @ 1 to 15 fps
*  mode 1 - 1MP (2048*544?) @ 1 to 30 fps
*  mode 2 - 0.5MP (1024*544) @ 1 to 60 fps (currently supported mode @ 30fps)
*  mode 3 - VGA (640*480) @ 1 to 70 fps

I'm modifying this pull request to set default camera raw image to mode 2 @ 30Hz, and frame rate will be adjustable by users within specified bounds.

Note that the default shipped stereo_image_proc generated point cloud output will be slow (~10Hz), but we'll try to get the raw images out at the rates described.

IMPORTANT: Please read

  • More extensive cloud testing is needed to see if the GPU in the cloud can support the rates stated. There is a distinct possibility that the upper bound of each resolution's frame rate will be reduced pending cloud machine status and testing.
